page.title: 18 The Armed Forces in Keith
page.content: The only permanent military presence in Keith is the Territorial Army Unit.This unit is attached to the Gordon Highlanders who have been based in Keith since 1969.The Gordons in Keith are only part-time soldiers but are commanded by a regular officer-Staff Sergeant Williams.The full complement consists of 30 men.They attend training camps nearly every weekend.Many men who joined the Keith unit as part-time soldiers are now in full-time Army Regiments serving abroad in places like Germany and Iceland.For a small unit the Territorials are well armed. Their weapons consist of Self Loading Rifles,Light and Heavy Machine Guns and Anti-Tank Rockets (64mm and 84mm). For transport they have one 4 tonne lorry and a Land Rover.The Drill Hall is situated in Union Street and there is an indoor firing range in Moss St.
